triples.name: Feature selection
triples.relevance: Core technique used to remove irrelevant or redundant features from datasets.

triples.name: Dimensionality reduction
triples.relevance: Fundamental problem addressed to alleviate the curse of dimensionality in high-dimensional data.

triples.name: Rough set
triples.relevance: Foundational theoretical framework used as the basis for neighborhood rough set model.

triples.name: Homogeneity and heterogeneity (statistics)
triples.relevance: Key concept for handling heterogeneous data containing both numerical and categorical attributes.

triples.name: Entropy (information theory)
triples.relevance: Fundamental concept underlying the novel neighborhood combination entropy measure proposed in the paper.

triples.name: Information gain (decision tree)
triples.relevance: Paper proposes a novel entropy-based measure (neighborhood combination entropy) as an alternative to traditional information gain for feature selection.

triples.name: Categorical variable
triples.relevance: Type of data handled by the proposed feature selection method for heterogeneous datasets.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Broader field in which feature selection enhances learning performance and interpretability.
